Articles.Content:
Hello,

I thought I'd join the forums and say hello. I've had KSP for a few days now and am already hooked. I have a million and one questions that will probably continue to be answered when I explore the tutorials so I don't have anything else to say apart from hello.

Anyway, I'm sure we all have ships in orbit and poor Kerbals stranded in space we have to figure out how to get back, so I'll say goodbye for now.

Thanks,

MrJim
G'day, always good to see another Aussie around here!

Thank you very much.

I haven't had much of a look around the forums yet but so far there seems to be answers to every question I've had and less snark (I'm sure it exists haha) than other forums. I'm still in the new and excited phase, so forgive this probably already covered question but that's a nice flag. Do you follow a theme like naming your spacecraft Scottish/Celtic ? related names? Samaras III or Bhoy I etc... haha

G'day,

In almost every forum I've joined, a fellow Aussie has taken it upon themselves to say g'day at the first opportunity and make me feel welcome, cheers. Where abouts in QLD are you? I'm about 60k's out of Melbourne... not that it matters, as here, aren't we all 0from Kerbal?

Anyway, I'm rambling because I've been up playing this bloody game so I'll let you so we can both get back to playing this bloody game, see ya around.

Cheers

MrJim

G'day.

The more Aussies the better I say.
